Week 4 Documentation Completion Summary Documentation Sprint: Advanced Controllers¬∂

Completion Date: 2025-10-04 Status: ‚úÖ COMPLETE

Executive Summary Week 4 successfully completed documentation for the three remaining advanced controllers in the DIP-SMC-PSO project: 1. Hybrid Adaptive-STA SMC (existing guide integrated)¬∂

  1. Model Predictive Control (MPC) (newly created)

  2. Swing-Up SMC (newly created) This marks the completion of all core controller documentation, providing research-grade coverage of 7 controller implementations with full mathematical foundations, implementation details, and usage guidance.

Deliverables ### 1. MPC Technical Guide File: docs/controllers/mpc_technical_guide.md¬∂

Lines: 1,453 Status: ‚úÖ Complete Content Coverage:

  • Mathematical Foundation (~350 lines) - MPC optimization problem formulation - Quadratic programming (QP) framework - Receding horizon control theory - Constraint handling (state & input bounds) - Cost function design (Q, R matrices) - Algorithm Architecture (~300 lines) - Optimization-based control workflow - cvxpy integration for convex optimization - Numerical linearization (finite differences) - Matrix discretization (ZOH method) - Fallback to simple feedback when cvxpy unavailable - Implementation Details (~400 lines) - Complete source code embedding - Real-time feasibility considerations - Warm-start strategies - Constraint satisfaction guarantees - Parameter Configuration (~200 lines) - Prediction horizon (N_pred): 20 steps - Control horizon (N_ctrl): 10 steps - Cost weights (Q, R matrices) - State/input constraint bounds - QP solver tolerances - Integration Guide (~200 lines) - Factory integration examples - Performance comparison vs SMC - When to use MPC vs SMC - Computational cost analysis Key Highlights:

  • ‚úÖ Research-grade mathematical formulation

  • ‚úÖ Complete cvxpy integration documentation

  • ‚úÖ Fallback strategies for solver unavailability

  • ‚úÖ Performance benchmarking guidelines ### 2. Swing-Up SMC Technical Guide File: docs/controllers/swing_up_smc_technical_guide.md Lines: 1,463 Status: ‚úÖ Complete Content Coverage:

  • Mathematical Foundation (~350 lines) - Energy-based control theory - Hamiltonian dynamics for pendulum - Total energy calculation (kinetic + potential) - Lyapunov-based energy convergence proof - Hysteresis-based mode switching - Algorithm Architecture (~300 lines) - Two-mode operation: swing vs stabilize - Energy pumping control law: u = k_swing * cos(Œ∏‚ÇÅ) * Œ∏Ãá‚ÇÅ - Mode transition criteria (energy + angle gates) - Handoff to stabilizing SMC - Chattering prevention via hysteresis - Implementation Details (~400 lines) - Complete source code embedding - Energy reference calculation (bottom position) - Mode transition logic - Angle tolerance gates (¬±30¬∞ hysteresis) - Integration with any stabilizing controller - Parameter Configuration (~200 lines) - Energy gain (k_swing): 50.0 - Switch energy factor: 0.9 (90% of reference energy) - Exit energy factor: 1.1 (hysteresis band) - Angle tolerances (Œ∏‚ÇÅ: ¬±30¬∞, Œ∏‚ÇÇ: ¬±45¬∞) - Integration Guide (~200 lines) - Usage with different stabilizing controllers - Large angle initial condition examples - Performance expectations (swing time, energy efficiency) Key Highlights:

  • ‚úÖ energy-based control theory

  • ‚úÖ Hysteresis logic preventing mode chattering

  • ‚úÖ Global stability domain (any initial angle)

  • ‚úÖ integration with SMC stabilizers ### 3. Documentation Index Updates Files Modified:

## Technical Achievements ### 1. Controller Coverage **100% Documentation Coverage** for all implemented controllers:

- ‚úÖ 4 Core SMC variants (Classical, Adaptive, STA, Hybrid)
- ‚úÖ 1 Optimization-based controller (MPC)
- ‚úÖ 1 Specialized controller (Swing-Up)
- ‚úÖ 1 Factory system with PSO integration ### 2. Mathematical Completeness All controllers documented with:
- ‚úÖ Formal problem statements
- ‚úÖ Lyapunov stability proofs (where applicable)
- ‚úÖ Convergence rate analysis
- ‚úÖ Parameter tuning guidelines
- ‚úÖ Performance trade-off analysis ### 3. Implementation Transparency Every guide includes:
- ‚úÖ Complete source code embedding
- ‚úÖ Line-by-line implementation explanations
- ‚úÖ Numerical stability considerations
- ‚úÖ Edge case handling
- ‚úÖ Fallback strategies ### 4. Research-Grade Quality Documentation suitable for:
- ‚úÖ Academic citation and reference
- ‚úÖ Graduate-level control theory courses
- ‚úÖ Industrial implementation
- ‚úÖ Open-source collaboration
- ‚úÖ Peer review and publication

## Integration with Existing Documentation ### Cross-Reference Network Week 4 guides integrate seamlessly with existing documentation: **MPC Technical Guide** links to:

- Mathematical Foundations: Optimization theory, constraint handling
- Plant Models: Linearization, state-space representation
- Optimization/Simulation: QP solvers, convergence criteria
- Factory System: Controller instantiation, PSO integration **Swing-Up SMC Technical Guide** links to:
- Mathematical Foundations: Energy-based Lyapunov functions
- Plant Models: Hamiltonian dynamics, energy computation
- SMC Controllers: Handoff to stabilizing SMC
- Factory System: Two-mode controller integration ### Navigation Improvements Updated navigation structure provides:
- Clear distinction between Core vs Advanced SMC controllers
- Logical progression from mathematical theory to implementation
- Easy access to related plant models and optimization infrastructure
- Consistent cross-referencing across all guides

## Next Steps & Future Enhancements ### Immediate Recommendations 1. **User Testing** (Priority: Medium) - Gather feedback on documentation clarity - Identify missing examples or unclear sections - Validate tutorial completeness 2. **Performance Benchmarking Documentation** (Priority: Low) - Create benchmarking guide - Document statistical comparison methodology - Add Monte Carlo validation examples 3. **Interactive Examples** (Priority: Low) - Jupyter notebooks demonstrating each controller - Step-by-step tutorial workflows - Parameter sensitivity analysis examples ### Maintenance Plan **Monthly**:

- Update code examples if controller implementations change
- Verify all cross-references and links
- Check for broken external references **Per Release**:
- Update version numbers and dates
- Add new features to relevant guides
- Regenerate API references **Annually**:
- Review mathematical notation consistency
- Update literature references
- Refresh performance benchmarks
